Title: Product Development Engineer II
Company: Sonion Vietnam
Location: Sonion Vietnam - Manufacturing, Lô I3-9, Khu Công Nghệ Cao, P. Tân Phú, Tp. Thủ Đức, Tp. Hồ Chí Minh
Job Description:
I. RANGE OF DUTIES:
• Development responsible for engineering projects run in VN
• Leads product development and integrate with process development using Lean Product Development method and Sonion Development Methodology (SDM) in order to bring the product to released status within the committed timeline and with the committed quality level and product cost.
• Works closely together with Project manager, Process development engineer, Production engineer, Quality engineer, Application engineer, and R&D Engineer in Europe where needed
• Gives input to project manager about the feasibility, timeline, and risks regarding the technical part of the project.
• Responsible for the R&D deliverables defined by the Milestone system.
• Responsible Development Engineer for projects transferred from Europe from design freeze to product release.
• Is early involved in the development project as contributor to the process/product concept choice. Input to the process feasibility of the concepts for production, inputs to the design FMEA, evaluates development samples produced in Vietnam. Together with process development engineer drives the product to release status.
• Conducts product failure analysis in cooperation with process development engineer and production engineering. Drives all development related failure modes to a conclusion and implements the corrective actions.
• Takes care of deliverables/project tasks before the design freeze if the work packages are within the engineer’s competences and agreed on in the project team.
• Development representative for released platforms and product variants
• Is the first contact point as R&D support for the released platforms and variants regarding changes in
• Responsible for development samples
• Executes sample requests from R&D in Europe for development project with existing production equipment in VN with committed timeline and quality requirements
• Cooperates with Prototype Engineer, process development engineer and designer of industrialization in VN for making first article samples in engineering projects run from VN
Job Requirements:
1. Education: University degree in Technical majors or Master degree is preferrable
2. Knowledge of computer servicing: Microsoft Office, SolidWorks
3. Knowledge of foreign languages:
• Proficient in both writing and verbal English (equivalent to IELTS 7.0+)
4. Other (e.g. competences):
• Team player, open minded, honest, target driven
• Transducer (or product) knowledge
5. Professional experience: 5+ years working experience in Engineering.

1. Nhà máy sữa Tiên Sơn - Khu Công nghiệp Tiên Sơn, Xã Hoàn Sơn, Huyện Tiên Du, Tỉnh Bắc Ninh

TÓM TẮT CÔNG VIỆC:

Chịu trách nhiệm trước Quản đốc sản xuất và Chuyên viên giám sát sản xuất phụ trách vận hành hệ thống/ thiết bị liên quan:

• Thực hiện vận hành theo đúng Hướng dẫn công việc đạt sản lượng — đảm bảo chất lượng, báo cáo kịp thời sự cố với cấp quản lý dé có biện pháp xử lý sự không phù hợp và hành động khắc phục phòng ngừa thích hợp.
• Kiểm tra chất lượng NVL đầu vào, SP đầu ra, định mức
• Ghi báo cáo số lượng sản phẩm thực hiện vào biểu mẫu theo quy định.
• Báo cáo kịp thời sự cố với cấp quản lý để có biện pháp xử lý sự không phù hợp và hành động khắc phục phòng ngừa thích hợp.
• Thực hiện, theo dõi sửa chữa và bảo trì máy móc thiết bị theo quy định.
• Giữ gìn vệ sinh sạch sẽ máy móc thiết bị nhà xưởng, đảm bảo an toàn vệ sinh thực phẩm theo quy định.
• Thực hiện đúng các yêu cầu của ISO 9001, ISO 14001, HACCP... và các quy định về ATVSLĐ, PCCC, 5S và các nội quy, quy định của nhà máy...
• Thực hiện theo đúng kế hoạch sản xuất & có phản hồi thông tin kịp thời.
• Đề xuất các sáng kiến cải tiến & hợp lý hóa (nếu có).
Job Requirements:
1. Học vấn:

- Nhân viên Vận hành máy: Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng/Trung Cấp chuyên ngành Công nghệ thực phẩm, Kỹ thuật Cơ, Điện, Điện tử, Tự động hóa hoặc các ngành kỹ thuật có liên quan.
- Nhân viên Vận hành hệ thống máy: Tốt nghiệp Đại học chuyên ngành Công nghệ thực phẩm, Kỹ thuật Cơ, Điện, Điện tử, Tự động hóa hoặc các ngành kỹ thuật có liên quan.

2. Kinh nghiệm:
- Ưu tiên kinh nghiệm làm việc trong ngành thực phẩm.

3. Kiến thức chuyên môn:
- Kiến thức cơ bản về an toàn vệ sinh thực phẩm
- Kiến thức cơ bản về công nghệ sản xuất
- Kiến thức cơ bản về ISO, HACCP, FSSC, Halal…
- Kỹ năng sắp xếp công việc tốt

4. Kỹ năng:
- Kỹ năng giải quyết vấn đề
- Kỹ năng giao tiếp

5. Yêu cầu khác:
- Cẩn thận, trung thực, kỷ luật

Job Title: Manager, HR Operations
Department: HR&C
Location: Pandora Production Vietnam (VSIP3, Binh Duong Province)
Reports To: HR&C Program Lead


About Company:
To meet the growing demand for our jewelry and enhance resilience to supply disruptions, Pandora is constructing a new facility in Binh Duong province from May 2024, expected to be opened in 2026. Pandora, the world’s largest jewelry brand by sold pieces, currently has 3 production facilities in Thailand with 13,000 staff. The US$160 million factory will cover an area of 7,5 hectares and will be powered by 100% renewable energy and using only recycled gold and silver supporting the Pandora Group’s target of net zero emissions by 2040. The establishment of Pandora’s sustainable jewelry manufactory in addition to the carbon-neutral exemplifies a new paradigm of environmentally conscious entrepreneurship in Vietnam and beyond.


Key objectives:
- Manage all aspects of pay roll, including time & attendance policies, operations, and reporting. Oversee benefits program, policies and claims processing
- Oversee end to end performance management of employees, including criteria, evaluation, and rewards/consequences of performance
- Build workplace happiness and uplift the employees‘ motivation and well being to support business objectives and sustainability.

Performance Management & Reward:
- Coordinate and support PPT P&R in the annual performance management cycle for both local and global process.
- Manage KPI linked performance incentives by ensuring timely KPI definition, target setting, and performance reviews
- Provide inputs on job performance to ensure appropriate level of compensation
- Monitor and control annual increase spending against budget for the entire company to ensure people cost effectiveness.
- Manage and develop end-to-end of compensation & Benefits structure like merit increase scheme, bonus to ensure compliance and transparency of rewarding & benefits program, promotion and transfer.
- Provide proposal, recommendation and guideline to Line Managers for merit increase, promotion increase and special adjustment request.
- Collaborate with finance and HR leadership to manage the budget for compensation and benefits.
- Coordinate with all divisions to administrate annual increase within the given time frame.
- Develop and implement P&R policies and procedures.
- Initiate new P&R program and work closely with HR Senior Management and Global HR to ensure all policies, procedure compliance.
- Keep update of the changes of related law and ensure enforcement in the organization.
- Prepare people cost forecast (salary, bonus, OT, provident fund, other benefits and actuarial valuation) based on FTE planning.

Operation:
- Process employee data changes such as new hires, terminations, promotions, and salary adjustments, while generating reports and providing HR metrics and analytics as needed.
- Administer compensation records for each employee from onboarding to departure.
- Stay updated on changes in employment laws and ensure their enforcement within the organisation.
- Be in charge of annual salary review process.
- Be responsible for E2E system related to employee’s cycles.

Employee Relation:
- Lead and ensure meticulous compliance with labor laws, labor union requirements, and Group/Local HR policies, fostering a workplace environment that values adherence to ethical standards and legal norms.
- Cultivate and nurture strong, positive relationships with key stakeholders, including the Ministry of Labor, Labor Union -
- Committee to proactively address potential challenges and promote a harmonious work atmosphere.
- Build and pull consistent and effective communication channels with the labor union committee through well-organized committee meetings, ensuring transparency and alignment with organizational goals.
- Undertake any other duties as necessary to ensure the smooth execution of employee activities and support the overall objectives of the organization
Job Requirements:
Qualifications & Experience:
- At least 7 years of experience in HR management.
- Experience in leading and managing activities.
- Experience in large size manufacturing is advantage.
- At least 3 years of experience working with trade union and labour relation
- Drive the solution to most complex business problems
- Possess the strategic perspective and create sustained results for Pandora (financial, non-financial)
- Demonstrate ability to make hard decisions, making the right trade-offs
- Effectively plan and efficiently deliver exceptional work while handling both volume and complexity
- Is an inspirational leader; practices genuine humility and places the team above their own interests
- Is self-motivated and hungry enough to work hard; willing to change
- Is smart about other people; has an ability to lead, manage, motivate, and run own team of future leaders
- Strong stakeholder management
- English fluency is a must
Keyword: Công Ty TNHH Pandora Production Việt Nam

Title: Data Analyst (MIS Officer)

Job Description:
I. Job Summary:

The key role is responsible for maintaining business reports and providing in-depth analysis to support decision making

• Be a bridge between business and IT for work-related data management.
• Design new useful reports by looking at new dimensions, indicators to provide more insights to business activities.
• Improve current reports or processes being implemented to improve business efficiency
• Provide business analytics such as customer segmentations, forecasts on business performance to enhance business efficiency.

b. Experience: At least two years of experience in Credit Risk Analytics, Retail Banking Analytics, Retail Risk Analytics or Credit Scoring, …, at banks or consumer finance companies with using analytical tools such as advanced Excel, SAS, Oracle, SQL, R.

c. Knowledge:
- Having logical thinking, statistical and mathematical knowledge.
- Experience in banking/consumer finance is required.

d. Skills:
- Analytical Thinking: The ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach.
- Strong at numerical skills, quick learner.
- Computer skills: MS Word, Excel, Power Point.
- Languages capability: Good command of spoken and written English and Vietnamese.

Title: Supervisor, Security Coordinator (Giám Sát, Điều Phối An Ninh)
Company: Công Ty TNHH Pandora Production Việt Nam
Location: Factory - VSIP III, Tan Uyen District, Binh Duong, Vietnam - Singapore Industrial Park III, Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen, Binh Duong
Job Description:
Job Title: Security Coordinator Supervisor
Company: Pandora Production Vietnam
Location: Factory - VSIP III, Tan Uyen District, Binh Duong Province
Industry: Jewelry Manufacturing

Job Overview
Pandora, a leading global jewelry manufacturer, is embarking on a multi-year expansion and has recently completed the groundbreaking of our new facility in Binh Duong, Vietnam. We are seeking an experienced Security Coordinator Supervisor to overlook our security activities in the new plant.

Key objectives: Ensure production and business receives right security support and coverage

Key duties:
- Execute tasks in accordance to the direction set by central security
- Plan to preventive maintenance security system, coordinate with relation function in order to maintenance, resolve and install security system.
- Respond to emergency situations according to procedure (i.e., fire, strike & protest, theft, threats)
- Security incident investigation and provide the results to relations
- Develop and update the security procedures, policy, and security plans for implementation on the site.
- Review and implement security procedure, rule & regulations
- Provide security budget and summary security expense
- Manage the security guard operations & performance to ensure compliance with compliance to compliance with SLAs
- Support HR (Employee Relations) on fraud / security breach case investigation
- Conduct security trainings for employees and contractors; lead security awareness and prevention programs at production site
- Provide monthly report (guard KPIs, incidents report and other security report related to security trends)
- Provide feedback to central security
- Implement, monitor and control Pandora’s security systems (ie., video surveillance, alarm system, access control)
- Manage security monitoring outsources on the operation in monitoring room.
- Coordinate with Security System & Contract specialist on selection and implementation of security systems; repair / fix security-related systems failures and coordinate with procurement and supplier for difficult failures
- Emergency response and command such as fire, intruder, strike & protest, theft, threat etc. including unusual situations.
- Support fraud / security breach case investigations in conjunction with HR (employee relations) and local security coordinator; provide evidence using security systems
- Provide monthly report, incidents report, unusual case related to the system fail, security recommendations whether related to security, safety or disciplinary cases.
Job Requirements:
What is needed to succeed:
- At least 3-5 years of security management system.
- Security contract management
- Knowledge on the security system, tools and equipment
- Security business process knowledge
- Physical security management in manufacturing environment with minimum 3 years or relevant experiences.
- Good Leadership, negotiation, teamwork, facilitation, evaluation and communication skills.
- Incident management & emergency response is required.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office, internet, web-based and job specific related software application
- Fluent in English communication


Due to the high volume of applications, we will only be reaching out to candidates who are being actively considered.
Keyword: Công Ty TNHH Pandora Production Việt Nam

Responsibility:

• Participate in artwork and labelling lifecycle coordination to ensure compliance with current regulatory Australian and export market requirements, including checking artworks for accuracy and compliance before print;
• Prepare and/or review QMS documentation including SOPs, specifications, and batch manufacturing/packaging records.
• Collate quality system information/data for effective trending purposes.
• Provide QA/regulatory support with new product development.
• Participate in investigation of customer complaints.
• Assist in the coordination of regulatory affairs/quality assurance projects, as assigned.
Job Requirements:
What do we expect from you:
• Holding a Bachelor of Pharmaceuticals/Chemistry or life science or similar areas.
• At least -2 years of relevant experience after graduation in a similar types of job
• English is a must with Reading and Writing of at least equivalent to IELTS 7.0/
• Excellent Microsoft word and excel skills, good with data presentation and analysis tool
• Excellent attention to details and passionate about being perfect with documentation and details
• Ability to juggle between various tight deadlines and projects
• Team players – ability to communicate with at least within Max Biocare Group’s internal departments and offices
• Open to learning and improvement and constant changes and challenges
• Ability to work independently, responsible and reliable with minimal supervision.

Report to:
- QA Manager and Reg Affair Associate.

Means of communication:
- Email
- Instant messaging: Microsoft Teams
- Telephone

Communication:
- Sales staff members in Vietnam and overseas
- Quality and Reg Affair staff overseas.
- Distributors, business partners in Vietnam and overseas.

Workday:
- Full time Monday – Friday.
- Plus 2 Saturday mornings per month.

Who we are:
Max Biocare is a leading Australian company with nearly 25 years of experience in bioscience and healthcare. We specialise in tailored and effective solutions in phytochemistry, pharmaceutical science, natural product supplements, nutraceuticals, cosmeceuticals, and veterinary health. With a global footprint and a dynamic approach, we're committed to making a positive impact on health and wellness worldwide.

Salary:
- Negotiable - depending on skills and experience.

What we offer for this position:
- Competitive salary and allowance package: $600 - $1000 depending on your qualitfication and experience.
- Full salary during probation
- 12 days’ work from home and 12 days paid annual leave.
- All employee benefits as per Vietnam’s labour laws.
- New year bonus
- Flexible work schedule when needed to support personal needs.
- Annual salary review.
- Opportunities for career advancement and personal development.
- Regular training opportunities

13th Floor, ICON4 Building, 243A Đê La Thành, Láng Thượng, Đống Đa, Hanoi.

Job Description:
MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC
A) Quản lý và vận hành các hoạt động được phân công của Phòng Đầu tư:

B) Chủ trì, tổ chức và điều phối các hoạt động được giao:
• Tìm kiếm, đánh giá, thẩm định và đề xuất các cơ hội đầu tư dự án; thực hiện phân tích tổng thể tính khả thi và hiệu quả của dự án trên các khía cạnh tài chính, pháp lý, kỹ thuật/xây dựng và vận hành.
• Xây dựng và phối hợp triển khai cấu trúc tài chính cho dự án (gồm vốn chủ sở hữu và vốn vay); trực tiếp tham gia thu xếp vốn/vay và giám sát, hỗ trợ quá trình giải ngân.
• Tham gia triển khai dự án đầu tư và quản lý danh mục đầu tư được phân công (bao gồm các hoạt động M&A, thoái vốn, tái cấu trúc tài sản/danh mục).
• Tham gia và phối hợp thực hiện các phân tích, đánh giá về kinh tế vĩ mô, ngành nghề và các hoạt động tài chính, đầu tư khác trong Tập đoàn.
C) Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác theo phân công của Lãnh đạo.
Job Requirements:

• Ít nhất 3 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí quản lý.
• Ưu tiên ứng viên có hiểu biết về chiến lược và vận hành trong các lĩnh vực như Bất động sản, Năng lượng.

Title: 3D Designer
Company: Article
Location: Ho Chi Minh, 1010 Raymur Avenue, Vancouver BC
Job Description:
Hi there, we’re Article. We’re a North American based furniture company creating remarkably better furniture experiences one sofa at a time. And as the 3D Designer, you’ll create high-quality 3D models for furniture and product visualization by converting SolidWorks models and scanned OBJ files into optimized 3ds Max assets.


Why We Need You:
As a 3D Designer, your main tasks will include re-topology, UV mapping, and texturing using Substance Designer. You will also review and improve vendor-created models to ensure they meet our quality standards. There might be occasions that you need to travel within Vietnam to factories for data capture, scanning, or measurements.


Why would a furniture company have a 3D & CGI team?
Our new 3D & CGI team at Article plays a pivotal role in showcasing our products and driving customer engagement. Your work will contribute to the visual appeal of our brand and directly impact customer perception.

CGI enables Article to expand the horizons of the eCommerce shopping experience in many new ways, including augmented reality, product and space configurators, and beyond.

This transformative approach offers us the speed and flexibility to remain highly competitive and carve out new ways to impress customers and gain market share.


Why Article?
While, we sell to the North American market, we work closely with a number of our manufacturing partners throughout Asia. As a result we have an office in Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, where we currently have around 50 Particles (people of Article) working.

As a Particle (people of Article), you will have a high level of autonomy to solve challenging, meaningful problems the best way you can. That means you’re trusted to explore solutions you believe will work best (you’re the expert, after all). You’ll do all this while growing your skills within a company that is redefining the furniture industry.


What You’ll Do:
You’ll be part of a team of 10 international marketing professionals working to build the asset library and ensure the accuracy of the product information.

• Convert SolidWorks parts/ assemblies and 3D scanned OBJ files into clean, native 3ds Max models.
• Re-topologize models to create efficient, accurate quad geometry.
• UV unwrap and texture assets using Substance Designer.
• Ensure high accuracy when recreating real-world products in 3D.
• Work within furniture and product visualization pipelines to produce high-quality assets.
• Review vendor-created 3D Solidworks and Scanned Models and ensure they meet quality standards.
• Understanding of photogrammetry techniques when necessary.
• Improve 3D workflows by suggesting better tools or processes.
• Occasionally travel within Vietnam to factories for data collection, scanning, and photography.
Job Requirements:
Who You Are:

• You have 4+ years of experience in 3D modeling, specializing in 3ds Max and UV mapping in Substance, with a strong understanding of furniture and product visualization.
• You are skilled in product scanning and photogrammetry workflows, bringing real-world objects into the digital space with precision.
• Your expertise in 3ds Max, UV mapping, and texturing in Adobe Substance enables you to create high-quality, photorealistic assets.
• You have a strong portfolio that showcases your ability to create detailed furniture or product 3D models in 3ds Max.
• You understand 3D model pipelines, particularly for furniture and product visualization, ensuring efficient and high-quality asset production.
• You have experience working with SolidWorks models and scanned OBJ files, converting them seamlessly into 3ds Max assets.
• You are familiar with Corona, V-Ray, and Reality Capture software, enhancing your ability to deliver high-quality renders and optimized models.
• If you have experience in architectural visualization, AR/VR, or 3D rendering, that’s a plus!
• You are detail-oriented, ensuring your 3D models maintain accuracy and meet high-quality standards.
• You have strong verbal and written communication skills in English, allowing you to collaborate effectively within a team and with external partners.

Title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
Company: MiTek Việt Nam
Location: A5 Building, Parcel A5, E-Office Park, Sang Tao Street, Tan Thuan EPZ, Tan Thuan Dong ward, Distric, Tòa nhà A5, lô số A5, khu E-Office, đường Sáng Tạo, KCX Tân Thuận, P. Tân Thuận Đông, Q.7, TP.HCM.
Job Description:
The Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist is responsible for activities of talent acquisition and assist with developing the employer branding of MiTek Vietnam to achieve recruitment targets for the whole Company.


Role, Responsibilities & Typical Activities

1. Execute recruiting strategies to deliver suitable candidates to meet recruiting request throughout the Company timely as well as research, develop new and creative recruiting ideas
2. Responsible for full-cycle recruitment and onboarding processes, including but not limited to, implement job requisition, screen candidates resumes and job applications, conduct interview and selection process, manage job offers including negotiation and administration, etc.
3. Source, create potential talent pool and attract candidates by using databases, social media, employee referral, etc.
4. Monitor, research and apply HR recruiting best practices
5. Responsible for signing labor contract process
6. Organize the Orientation program for new employees in order to become fully integrated.
7. Organize job seminars, career events, office tours, etc.
8. Maintain recruiting data of HR software and report the progress on assigned job vacancies, provide the regular feedback about the performance of the recruitment process
9. Support and collaborate with key stakeholders, on the continuous development / improvement or processes to meet business needs, driving efficiency, and reducing wasteful activity to promote workable solutions
10. Provide explanation, guidance and counsel in human resources matters for employees within the responsibility
11. Manage the termination procedure of trainingship and probation for employees
12. Provide guidance, support and task review for team members
13. Other reasonable duties as assigned
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor degree in Human resource/ Business or relevant majors
• 5+ year of experience in recruiting; Experience in IT Technical, mass recruitment. IT knowledge is preferable
• A board understanding of recruiting process, talent acquisition activities and the ways of approaching and utilizing potential candidate resources
• Good communication skills in both English and Vietnamese; English level (CEFR) B1 or equivalent;
• Highly responsible, hard-working, can work under pressure and deadline
• Must be flexible on work schedule based on the recruitment activity requirements and success pattern.
